items.headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang delivers some good news for investors at CES
items.summary_en: Huang devoted much of his speech to real-world AI. But he also said six words that should appeal to Wall Street: “Vera Rubin is in full production.”

items.headline: These surging stocks just saved the ‘Santa Claus rally.’ Here’s what turned things around.
items.summary_en: U.S. stocks staged a dramatic rebound to kick off the first full trading week of the new year, just in time to rescue the so-called Santa Claus rally from going missing for another year.

items.headline: Chevron and Exxon stocks jump. Here’s what analysts are saying about big oil companies after Maduro’s capture.
items.summary_en: Chevron shares were among the big gainers on Monday as investors gauged the impact of U.S. actions against Venezuela, including the capture of Nicolás Maduro.

items.headline: Mobileye’s latest win is another rejection of Tesla’s self-driving approach

items.headline: Spending over $100 billion to rebuild Venezuela’s oil industry won’t be the biggest obstacle facing U.S. oil companies
items.summary_en: For the oil market, the hype is real — the U.S. now has the opportunity to to more freely access crude from Venezuela, a country that’s widely accepted to be home to the world’s largest oil reserves. But the reality is that U.S. oil companies may not be all that eager to jump in.
